1.content:
So, it's time to determine what cryptid will be your character's parent. To try an create some order there will be five categories of cryptids, by clicking the right category you'll be able to choose the cryptid you'd like.

Please note, there are a lot of cryptids in folk-lore (More so that I'm including mythical creatures as well.) so I won't have every cryptid in the list. If you'd like a cryptid added please ask me instead of adding it yourself so that it can go into the right category.

So the categories are as followed.

Land-Dwelling Cryptids
Simply, cryptids that walk and live on land, this category won't include human cryptids or creatures that are regularly depicted using magic.
Examples of the Cryptids in this category: Big Foot (All of them), Mongolian Death Worm, Chupacabra, Tatzelwurm.

Aquatic Cryptids
Cryptids of the sea, any cryptid that lives in the ocean or bodies of water. Amphibians will only be included if they are known to live in water, unlike the first category this one will include human creatures (aka mermaids.)
Examples of Cryptids in this category: Bunyip, Leviathan, Nessie, Kraken.

Flying Cryptids
Cryptids that have the ability to fly, this category does not contain cryptids who have the ability to fly using supernatural means, it will also exclude humans.
Examples of Cryptids in this category: Mothman, Ahool, Thunderbird, Jersey Devil.

Supernatural Cryptids
Human cryptids and creatures that have been known to use magic.
Examples of Cryptids in this category: Baba Yaga, Vampires, Were-wolves, Fairies, Jinn.

Mythological Creatures
Monsters and creatures found in mythology that aren't nesseccarily considered cryptids.
Examples of creatures found in this category: Hydra, Griffin, Draugr, Xiezhi.
1.title: The Child Of A Monster

11.content:
Here is the list of the cryptids that walk primarily on land.

Instead of making a separate option for each Big Foot (Since there is a lot of them!) the Big Foot choice will split off into all the others. So if you're looking for a ten-foot-tall hairy man, look there.
11.title: They Roam The Forests!

111.content:
Big Foot is the world's most well-known cryptid for a reason, every continent bar Antarctica has at least one of them. I will put as many as I could find here but there are a lot.

The Wendigo, Mapingauri and Orang Pendek are sometimes considered a type of Big Foot but there are too many differences between them and the general depiction of Big Foot. Mapingauri and Orang Pendek can be found in the land category and Wendigo in the supernatural.
111.title: Hard to find good shoes

1113.content: Interesting fact about Big Feet: Big Foot, more notably, Sasquatch, has appeared in roughly 61 movies.
1113.title: All The Single Big Feet!

11133.content: Interesting Fact about Big Feet: The Yeti is always depicted as having white fur in cartoons and films, in reality, it's recorded as being a reddish-brown colour.
11133.title: Lot of Feet

111333.content: Interesting Fact about Big Feet: There are at least 12 different kinds of Big Foot in the US alone.
111333.title: More Big Feet

115.content: Here are a few more monsters to be the children of.
115.title: Plenty of Land Critters

12.content:
Here are the cryptids that inhabit our oceans and lakes. In my opinion, these are the most likely kinds of Cryptids to be real.

Similarly to Big Foot, all the lake monsters will be under the same category, I'm pretty sure there is also one of them in each continent bar Antarctica.
12.title: The Deep Blue Sea!

121.content: Everyone knows about Nessie, the most controversial cryptid there is. Well, she isn't alone, there are loads of lake monsters all over the world.
121.title: Good Old Nessie And Pals

1213.content: Interesting Nessie Facts: Part of Loch Ness is 812 feet deep and is called Nessie's Lair.
1213.title: Watch Out When You Go Swimming

13.content:
Here is a list of cryptids that prefer to fly around rather than walk.

I will be placing Owlman and Mothman under the same category and splitting them up after, really the only difference between them is that one is English and the other American.
13.title: Up Up And Away

131.content: So, would you like to be English or American? They may call him Mothman but he looks more like an owl.
131.title: Different kinds of English

info.brief_description: Survival isn't as easy as it sounds when the world sees you as a monster.
info.description:
Take up the role of the half-human child of famous cryptids living in a world where they are considered monsters and hunted. Will you choose to wage war against the human, try to hide yourself and others like you, or maybe even help the humans hunt others of your kind? The choice is yours.

Cryptids in this story aren't just wild animals that the world has yet to discover. (Considering they have human children that would just be weird) They are sentient beings, however way you which that to be portrayed. They could be supernatural beings, gods, cursed humans etc.

In the story, the characters will all be at least partially human, after all, there needs to be something that connects them to the human world. But how much of them is human and how much it shows is up to you, they could look completely normal except for having odd abilities, or they may look like a younger version of their cryptid parent.


Now for the rules! They're pretty much the same my other interactives but read them anyway to refresh yourself.

This is a 13+ story: I'm sure you can read up on the specifics of what that means but essentially make it appropriate for young teens and older to be reading.

In regards to cryptids with multiple origins (most notably, were-wolves): There won't be a separate line for Gevaudan were-wolves and Lycaon were-wolves, or any of the other million were-wolf origins, after picking were-wolf you can choose which were-wolf origin to use in your character's story, not all characters have to use the same as the others. But if it has already been mentioned in a story that the character is the great great great great great great grandson of Lycaon's youngest son, don't suddenly change it to them being a descendant of someone bitten by the Bete de Gevaudan.

Nice long chapters: No one likes one-liners, they waste chapters, there's no point asking people if they want the character to be called Fred or Mike, just pick the name you like and if someone doesn't like the name, they can always make a different storyline with their own characters.

Allow multiple characters: When starting a story, make sure to leave an option for someone to create a different character, not everyone wants to play the same character as you do, and hey, with more characters being made you could even have them appear in another character's story as friends or something.

Go Wild! As long as you stick to the 13+ get a crazy as you want with the stories, these are your stories and you can shape them in any way you want. You want your character to have a 50-foot one-eyed, one-horned flying purple people-eater as a pet? then go right ahead (Though maybe teach it to eat pork instead) I'm not going to delete chapters for being too crazy, as long as the other rules are followed you have free reign.
